name: 2-propanol, 1-chloro-2-methyl-
Reason: The compound 1-chloro-2-methyl-2-propanol includes an isopropyl group, a chloro substituent, and a hydroxyl group (alcohol). Starting with propane as the base structure with a melting point of -188°C, we consider the following: The addition of an isopropyl group would tend to increase the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and branching which increases the melting point by roughly 30°C. A chloro substituent adds substantial mass and some polarity, which may further increase the melting point by approximately 50°C. However, the introduction of the hydroxyl group provides strong hydrogen bonding, leading to a much higher increase in the melting point, estimated at 120°C. Combining these modifications: -188 (propane) + 30 (isopropyl) + 50 (chloro) + 120 (hydroxyl), we get a predicted value.
